Hi All,

I am fairly new to Heritrix. I am using Heritrix-1.14 and need some help in using the DecideRules correctly.

I want to be able to crawl pages from a host *except* for URIs that match 
this pattern
^(http://.*example.com/datestamp/2009(?!oct12))
Basically I intend to capture data relevant only to today's datestamp and not the past. This is typical of a daily content management system.

My ordered decideRules are:

RejectDecideRule
SurtPrefixedDecideRule. 
TooManyHopsDecideRule
PathologicalPathDecideRule.
TooManyPathSegmentsDecideRule. 
MatchesRegExpDecideRule. 
   decision: REJECT
   regex: ^(http://.*example.com/datestamp/2009(?!oct12))
PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule. 

my test seed:   
http://www.example.com/article/2009oct09/xyz/91012026/some-page

Should not this URI be rejected? my crawler crawls this uri!

Even with seed being www.example.com, ALL the datestamps get crawled.
I would appreciate any help on this.

Thanks!
Pranay
